intro: Hieracium cyclophyllum, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium cyclophyllum is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade to full sun.
